concise_definition: v. 批准, 同意, 赞成

definitions.explanation_en: To officially accept or authorize something, especially by a person or body in a position of authority, often after review or evaluation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由有权人士或机构在审查或评估后，正式接受或授权某事。
definitions.example_en: The board approved the new budget proposal last week.
definitions.example_cn: 董事会上周批准了新的预算提案。

definitions.explanation_en: To express favorable opinion or support for something, often based on personal judgment or moral alignment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指基于个人判断或道德认同，表达对某事的赞成或支持态度。
definitions.example_en: I approve of your decision to volunteer at the shelter.
definitions.example_cn: 我赞成你去收容所做志愿者的决定。

definitions.explanation_en: To show satisfaction or approval through non-verbal cues or behavior, such as nodding or smiling.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过非语言行为（如点头、微笑）表现出认可或满意。
definitions.example_en: She smiled and gave a slight nod to approve his performance.
definitions.example_cn: 她微笑着微微点头，表示认可他的表现。

comparison.analysis: “Authorize” (授权) 更强调赋予法律或正式权力，通常涉及制度性流程，如签署文件、发放许可。而 “approve” 可以是正式的，也可以是主观的，范围更广，不一定涉及权力授予。
“Endorse” (支持/背书) 常用于公众人物或机构公开支持某人或某事，带有宣传或推荐的意味，如名人代言、政党背书。而 “approve” 更侧重于个人或机构的判断性认可，不一定公开表达。
“Consent” (同意) 强调在知情前提下给予许可，尤其在法律、医疗或伦理语境中，常涉及权利让渡，如手术同意书。它更被动、更谨慎，而 “approve” 更主动，常含评价性判断。
